description: Documentation for 9.4. Type Information for Instructions and Operands

files.title: Overview
files.summary: Typed instructions must have a type-size modifier. For example, the `add` instruction requires type and size information to properly perform the addition operation (signed, unsigned, float, different sizes), and this information must be specified as a suffix to the opcode.

files.title: 9.4.1. Operand Size Exceeding Instruction-Type Size
files.summary: For convenience, `ld`, `st`, and `cvt` instructions permit source and destination data operands to be wider than the instruction-type size, so that narrow values may be loaded, stored, and converted using regular-width registers.
